net.sourceforge.taglets.simple
Interface UndefinedTagSupport

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConstantsBlockTaglet, SinceBlockTaglet
public interface UndefinedTagSupport

Extended interface for BlockTaglets.

BlockTaglets implementing UndefinedTagSupport will be notified whenever a tag is not defined for the currently parsed element.

Implement this interface if you want to generate additional documentation without having to specify a tag everywhere or if you simply want to test for the existence of a tag at a specific location.

Note:

Method undefinedTag(Logger, DocletParameter) is especially handy when checking the parameter for DocletParameter, see the example below.

Example:

public void undefinedTag (Logger logger, DocletParameter parameter) {
   final Doc holder= parameter.getTagHolder();
   if (holder instanceof FieldDoc && ((FieldDoc) holder).isPublic()) {
     logger.error("Do not use public fields!");
   }
   return null;
 }

Method Summary
 String undefinedTag(Logger logger, DocletParameter parameter)

Method Detail

undefinedTag

String undefinedTag(Logger logger,
                    DocletParameter parameter)
Called whenever the currently processed documentation element does not define this tag.

Parameters:
logger - the logger to use for emiting messages.
parameter - the parameter for the tag currently processed.
Returns:
the output text to use in the documentation, null to avoid creating documentation output.
Since:
1.8.2
